resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
fsaintjacques commented on pull request #4605: ARROW-5631: [C++] Fix FindBoost targets with cmake3.2
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4605
 
 
   cmake's FindBoost pre 3.5 did not export IMPORTED targets. This also fixes the newly introduced trusty docker image.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

fsaintjacques commented on pull request #4605: ARROW-5631: [C++] Fix FindBoost targets with cmake3.2
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4605#discussion_r294915690
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/cmake_modules/ThirdpartyToolchain.cmake
 ##########
 @@ -582,39 +582,43 @@ else()
   if(ARROW_BOOST_USE_SHARED)
     # Find shared Boost libraries.
     set(Boost_USE_STATIC_LIBS OFF)
+    # Stash BUILD_SHARED_LIBS
     set(BUILD_SHARED_LIBS_KEEP ${BUILD_SHARED_LIBS})
     set(BUILD_SHARED_LIBS ON)
 
     if(MSVC)
       # force all boost libraries to dynamic link
       add_definitions(-DBOOST_ALL_DYN_LINK)
     endif()
-
-    if(ARROW_BOOST_HEADER_ONLY)
-      find_package(Boost REQUIRED)
-    else()
-      find_package(Boost COMPONENTS regex system filesystem REQUIRED)
-      set(BOOST_SYSTEM_LIBRARY Boost::system)
-      set(BOOST_FILESYSTEM_LIBRARY Boost::filesystem)
-      set(BOOST_REGEX_LIBRARY Boost::regex)
-      set(ARROW_BOOST_LIBS ${BOOST_SYSTEM_LIBRARY} ${BOOST_FILESYSTEM_LIBRARY})
-    endif()
-    set(BUILD_SHARED_LIBS ${BUILD_SHARED_LIBS_KEEP})
-    unset(BUILD_SHARED_LIBS_KEEP)
   else()
     # Find static boost headers and libs
     # TODO Differentiate here between release and debug builds
     set(Boost_USE_STATIC_LIBS ON)
-    if(ARROW_BOOST_HEADER_ONLY)
-      find_package(Boost REQUIRED)
+  endif()
+
+  if(ARROW_BOOST_HEADER_ONLY)
+    find_package(Boost REQUIRED)
+  else()
+    find_package(Boost COMPONENTS regex system filesystem REQUIRED)
+    if(CMAKE_VERSION VERSION_LESS 3.5)
+      # Cmake's FindBoost started exporting IMPORTED in 3.5
+      set(BOOST_SYSTEM_LIBRARY ${Boost_SYSTEM_LIBRARY})
+      set(BOOST_FILESYSTEM_LIBRARY ${Boost_FILESYSTEM_LIBRARY})
+      set(BOOST_REGEX_LIBRARY ${Boost_REGEX_LIBRARY})
     else()
-      find_package(Boost COMPONENTS regex system filesystem REQUIRED)
       set(BOOST_SYSTEM_LIBRARY Boost::system)
       set(BOOST_FILESYSTEM_LIBRARY Boost::filesystem)
       set(BOOST_REGEX_LIBRARY Boost::regex)
-      set(ARROW_BOOST_LIBS ${BOOST_SYSTEM_LIBRARY} ${BOOST_FILESYSTEM_LIBRARY})
     endif()
+    set(ARROW_BOOST_LIBS ${BOOST_SYSTEM_LIBRARY} ${BOOST_FILESYSTEM_LIBRARY})
   endif()
+
+  if(ARROW_BOOST_USE_SHARED)
 
 Review comment:
   I'm not sure why this was like this, if someones wants to clarify, I'll gladly add a comment to the PR (@xhochy, @wesm).
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

users@infra.apache.org

   https://github.com/apache/arrow/commit/f014d76c68a9a977a19f87f7ea77511e4753bb8c

kou commented on pull request #4605: [WIP] ARROW-5631: [C++] Fix FindBoost targets with cmake3.2
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4605#discussion_r295046486
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/cmake_modules/ThirdpartyToolchain.cmake
 ##########
 @@ -582,39 +582,43 @@ else()
   if(ARROW_BOOST_USE_SHARED)
     # Find shared Boost libraries.
     set(Boost_USE_STATIC_LIBS OFF)
+    # Stash BUILD_SHARED_LIBS
     set(BUILD_SHARED_LIBS_KEEP ${BUILD_SHARED_LIBS})
     set(BUILD_SHARED_LIBS ON)
 
     if(MSVC)
       # force all boost libraries to dynamic link
       add_definitions(-DBOOST_ALL_DYN_LINK)
     endif()
-
-    if(ARROW_BOOST_HEADER_ONLY)
-      find_package(Boost REQUIRED)
-    else()
-      find_package(Boost COMPONENTS regex system filesystem REQUIRED)
-      set(BOOST_SYSTEM_LIBRARY Boost::system)
-      set(BOOST_FILESYSTEM_LIBRARY Boost::filesystem)
-      set(BOOST_REGEX_LIBRARY Boost::regex)
-      set(ARROW_BOOST_LIBS ${BOOST_SYSTEM_LIBRARY} ${BOOST_FILESYSTEM_LIBRARY})
-    endif()
-    set(BUILD_SHARED_LIBS ${BUILD_SHARED_LIBS_KEEP})
-    unset(BUILD_SHARED_LIBS_KEEP)
   else()
     # Find static boost headers and libs
     # TODO Differentiate here between release and debug builds
     set(Boost_USE_STATIC_LIBS ON)
-    if(ARROW_BOOST_HEADER_ONLY)
-      find_package(Boost REQUIRED)
+  endif()
+
+  if(ARROW_BOOST_HEADER_ONLY)
+    find_package(Boost REQUIRED)
+  else()
+    find_package(Boost COMPONENTS regex system filesystem REQUIRED)
+    if(CMAKE_VERSION VERSION_LESS 3.5)
+      # Cmake's FindBoost started exporting IMPORTED in 3.5
+      set(BOOST_SYSTEM_LIBRARY ${Boost_SYSTEM_LIBRARY})
+      set(BOOST_FILESYSTEM_LIBRARY ${Boost_FILESYSTEM_LIBRARY})
+      set(BOOST_REGEX_LIBRARY ${Boost_REGEX_LIBRARY})
     else()
-      find_package(Boost COMPONENTS regex system filesystem REQUIRED)
       set(BOOST_SYSTEM_LIBRARY Boost::system)
       set(BOOST_FILESYSTEM_LIBRARY Boost::filesystem)
       set(BOOST_REGEX_LIBRARY Boost::regex)
-      set(ARROW_BOOST_LIBS ${BOOST_SYSTEM_LIBRARY} ${BOOST_FILESYSTEM_LIBRARY})
     endif()
+    set(ARROW_BOOST_LIBS ${BOOST_SYSTEM_LIBRARY} ${BOOST_FILESYSTEM_LIBRARY})
   endif()
+
+  if(ARROW_BOOST_USE_SHARED)
 
 Review comment:
   This is needed to work with `BoostConfig.cmake` provided by Boost (not CMake).
   The Boost package provided by MSYS2 installed `BoostConfig.cmake` at the time.
   But the current Boost package doesn't install `BoostConfig.cmake`: https://github.com/msys2/MINGW-packages/pull/5326/files
   
   See also: https://github.com/msys2/MINGW-packages/issues/5233
   
   There is no platform that needs this. So we can remove this for now but we may need this again in the future.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

users@infra.apache.org

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

comments.body: This failure was likely introduced in https://github.com/apache/arrow/commit/f913d8f0adff71c288a10f6c1b0ad2d1ab3e9e32
Not sure if coincidence, but googling for "cmake curl https" returns this as first hit https://stackoverflow.com/questions/44633043/cmake-libcurl-was-built-with-ssl-disabled-https-not-supported
Looks like a problem with the Anaconda cmake version. Probably need to build CMake from source in the Docker image, what do you think?
